Name: Stela of Taharqa Praying to Amun-Re
Description: The stela dates to the sixth year of Taharqa's reign, which was a bad year for the Egyptians. The first eight lines of this inscription give the royal titles and extol the benefits of King Taharqa's rule. The remainder of the inscriptions state that the king prayed to Amun-Re to allow the Nile to flood. He adds that his prayers were answered in such a way that the whole country flooded and resembled the ocean. Ancient records indicate that the Nile flooded greatly due to excessive rains in Nubia.
